bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: By Mr. MICHAUD:H.R. 3040.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8,[Page H5402]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.

item.text: Safe Freight Act - Prohibits the operation of a freight train or light locomotive engine used in the movement of freight unless it has a crew of at least two individuals, one of whom is certified by the Federal Rail Administration as a locomotive operator and the other as a train conductor.
item.name: Introduced in House
Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Subcommittee

item.title: To provide for the minimum size of crews of freight trains, and for other purposes.

bill.title: Safe Freight Act

committee.name: Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
